intro: Chorizanthe nudicaulis, commonly known as the slender jointweed, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Amaranthaceae family, which includes many species with showy flowers and often succulent leaves. The plant typically grows in dry, sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. Its small, greenish-yellow flowers are clustered in dense, spike-like inflorescences. Chorizanthe nudicaulis is characterized by its narrow, upright stems and reduced leaves, which help minimize water loss in its harsh habitat.
